metadata.name: Scoops #36
metadata.description:

Press D to save a 4000x4000 png

We all scream for Ice-Cream

*inhales*(」･o･)」
AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH

metadata.name: Florescence #262
metadata.description:
Digitally crafted flowers in pots for virtual window sills.

In the spirit of the piranha plant from the Mario Bros videogame. We wanted to create a project that acknowledges the playful depiction of nature in early videogames by creating a retro futuristic collectible that explores aesthetics over gameplay, whilst preserving the playful energy of these early digital worlds. There are many game elements that have emerged over the years that have become iconic in their own right. Their memorable designs have come to represent the exciting feeling of when we first discovered these worlds, but over time an appreciation for their simple design execution, harmony and balance has emerged. Art can exist in many forms and places including a digital pot plant.

Rarity:

There are a total of 23 hand-drawn and animated sprites divided into 4 groups Firelillies, Flytraps, Quasars and Stargazers and there are 15 possible combinations made from these 4 groups. 18% of the collection is a combination of these 4 groups which we can call random and the remaining 72% is divided between the remaining 14 combinations.


There are 3 possible grid systems 1x1, 3x3 and 4x4 

3% 1x1

40% 3x3

57% 4x4



There are 14 possible placement points for all grids and 76 stem/sprite arragement in total



For the pots and stems there are 11 colors to choose and  no rarities for color combinations.



The flower distribution can be either symmetric or random. 35% symmetric and 65% random



Export options:

Pressing 's' on desktop or holding for 2 seconds will download gif to whatever the current device resolution is. To export at a different resolution open the token in new window by clicking 'open' link under the token image and add "&exportsize=1080" or "&exportsize=2160" to end of the url and hit enter then either hold for 2 seconds or press 's' to create gif and download.

metadata.name: Faux #255
metadata.description:
This project is borne out of my longstanding fascination with brushwork, and the intricate textures that can be created with a brush, some paint and a canvas. Brush strokes are simulated using many overlapping lines and given texture and depth using a custom shader. Another important aspect of this work, is the composite forms that are created by the brush strokes, which are my attempt to emulate the emphatic energy of many abstract painters that have come before me. Color palettes are named after common paint colors, based on the background color used for the palette.

Those who collect during the first tier of the Dutch Auction can claim a signed print. They will be printed on A3 Hahnemuhle Photo Rag, and shipped to the collector free of charge. More details on how to claim a print and specify the necessary shipping information will be provided via the artists twitter (@landlinesart1).

In live mode, add &size=<YOUR_PIXEL_SIZE> to change the pixel size of the image for export (Right click to save). For example, &size=4000 will set the width of the image to be 4000 pixels.

metadata.name: R1B2 Christmas Gift #19
metadata.description:
Merry Christmas !
If somehow you don't like your iteration, ping me on Discord. I'll replace it with one from the curated collection on objkt.com

metadata.name: freeflow #284
metadata.description:
This is my gift to the fxhash community. I have been with this community since it's inception, and will continue to spend my days checking out what's being made by the very creative folks here.
Thank you all for putting a smile on my face every day and I hope you get a great piece!

Made in p5.js on Dec 5th, 2021 by twistie.

metadata.description:
Generative art by Mark Knol (@mknol)

An abstract minimalistic mill, 10 color modes. 
Colors inspired by Piet Mondrian.

metadata.name: BWEEPS  #37
metadata.description:
A minimalist, black-and-white generative profile picture (PFP) created to commemorate one-year anniversary of Bwople project by Gengoya. The artwork is derived from an initial sketch of Bwople which, despite being not the one that was chosen, still managed to captivate interests. The project provides a unique glimpse into an alternate universe in which Bwople could have been represented.

All images are hand-drawn work by Gengoya and composed by Vector Recite using PureSpider's fxhash-pfp maker tool.

To download the full size image on fx(hash):
- Click "open" below the image
- Left click on the image, a "Download image" button will appear on the bottom right.
- Click the "Download image" button.

metadata.name: Coronado #87
metadata.description:
This series is about the beauty and charm of imperfection, chaos amidst order, and letting go. It's about knowing that however much control we think we may have, things can all fall apart or burst into something unexpectedly wonderful at any moment, even without our hands tightly on the reigns.

Please see fxtext article linked from main project page for more background on the project and rendering notes.

Some key commands in live mode:

G : Toggle grain
S : Save current resolution
1 : 4000x5000
2 : 6000x7500
3 : 8000x10000
4 : 10000x12500
5 : 12000x15000
6 : 14000x17500
(1-6 work best on Chrome)
(rendering takes longer as resolution increases)

metadata.name: ____ - Iteration 1 #81
metadata.description:
This project is part of a larger experiment that explores and celebrates the process of making generative art by progressively releasing iterations, working towards a final release on my main account (tz1RkYY3jr1ocuPdQqrRefr5FqoawKQsmBmD). The iterations will be titled ____ 0.1, ____ 0.2, etc. At this point, the number of iterations has not been determined, but more information will be provided as this experiment unfolds.

The final release will only be made available to those who have collected each iteration (using an allowlist), and will be released for free.

metadata.name: Giant Steps #133
metadata.description:
𝄆 Giant Steps 𝄂

Press 1, 2, 3 or 4 to change the pixel density, press ’s’ to save as PNG.

metadata.name: Glomularus #115
metadata.description:
Glomularus is an exploration in generative, artificial life forms. The project is an extension of my Protobyte series, begun in 2004.

Driven by Verlet icosahedra and responsive tendrils, Glomulari live in a spherical virtual ecosystem (V-eco) enhanced through user interaction.

Interaction:

Mouse/Trackpad:
  drag -> camera rotation
  drag + CMD/CTR -> camera pan
  scroll wheel/pinch -> camera zoom

Key Input:
  1-9: add acceleration
  -, +: reduce | increase V-eco sphere radius
  f, g: reduce | increase fog
  p: screen capture

Tip:
To decrease creature acceleration, reduce V-eco sphere radius

Note:
Please post your favorite Glomularus screen captures
TW: @iragreenberg
IG: @greenberg.ira

Built with Three.js, PByte.js, TypeScript, Node

metadata.name: Vents #421
metadata.description:
Near the start of December @Studio Yorktown launched his "Studio Yorktown Color Town Hall" library of wonderful colour palettes.

"You know what this Town Hall needs?" I asked no one in particular, "Vents!". Besides, what's more Christmassy than a good old vent?

Some nice soothing gradients, with a selection of innies and outies, structure, form, and sometimes sharp edges. I humbly suggest aiming to get a set of three 😁

Thank you for everything fxhash in 2022, looking forwards to 2023!

READ MORE: https://www.fxhash.xyz/article/vents

INSTRUCTIONS ::

h - Toggle high-res
n - toggle noise on/off
s - Download and save image

PRINTING INSTRUCTIONS ::

High-res will output a 8,192 x 8,192 image, at 300dpi it should print at...

27.3 x 27.3 inches
69.3 x 69.3 cm

metadata.name: Shattered Moons #552
metadata.description:
🌘🌗🌖Shattered Moons🌔🌓🌒

Explore deep space moons through this pure SVG generative experiment.

Features:
- Striped Background
- Shadows
- Vapors
- Horizontal Vapors
- Meteors
- Colored Meteors
- White Moon (0.5%)

SVG being a vectorial format, this work can be displayed/printed at any size.
Press 's' on Live View to save the SVG.
Press 'p' on Live View using a Chromium based browser to export as PNG.

Also, to fully enjoy your piece, I'd suggest to use a Chromium based browser as the SVG renderer gives more details.

metadata.name: Gerhard #250
metadata.description:
Gerhard is a collaboration of Richard Nadler and Leander Herzog on fxhash. A generative animation based on multiple layers of color and data, mixed, moved and painted over in realtime. Some fragments stick to the canvas while others get discarded to leave the existing layers visible, allowing a complex surface to emerge and build up over time. 
Richard Nadler created the textures to control composition and color. Leander Herzog created the code for the interplay between the layers, motion and interactions. Both artists use different tools and are not aware of the details of each others process, meeting through the interface of pixels. This collaboration is enabled by twitter and fxhash, as the generative art community continues to explore abstraction in summer 2022 – while extreme temperatures, wildfires, ongoing conflicts and volatile markets continue to escalate. 

- Click to start a new layer of motion and color. 
- Doubleclick to enter fullscreen mode. 
- Press “s” to save the current canvas. 
- Append ?dpr=4 to the url to increase the resolution.

https://leanderherzog.ch/2022/gerhard/

metadata.name: stellar nurseries #20
metadata.description:
stellar nurseries is a gpu-accelerated particle system created with clojurescript and webgl.

press "c" to capture a screenshot.

metadata.name: FLUX #111
metadata.description:
The code work I am most interested in creating with p5js in 2022 is a type of creation where various elements are developed in a drow() loop based on an initial state.
"Flux" also recursively generates visual images based on the initial state. The result is a form reminiscent of architecture, cityscapes, or neural networks.

Through the use of the noise() function, the code initially draws lines that are then extended vertically and randomly slide across a certain area.  By repeating this process recurrently, the work itself becomes a visual image, with itself as a constituent element, while being damaged.

"Flux" is also a work about autopoiesis (or self-organization) in damage.

The get()set() is to treat the image generated by the code as an image(), and it may damage the purity of the work as a code. Therefore, I view random get()set() as a metaphor for damage.

The parameter “interrupt” has a certain probability of being “true”; if it is “true”, the density of the strokes is reduced, but in combination with other parameters, it is not easy to determine whether interrupt is “true” or “false”. Therefore, it is a practically meaningless parameter (attribute), but I added this parameter to imagine an artificiality in the code of nature.

Creating a dimensionless image (one that maintains the same output regardless of screen size) was a challenge due to the inevitable deterioration in resolution and rendering content when the same processing is performed at a smaller size. In order to prioritize resolution, the image was generated at a fixed size and displayed according to the screen size.

It is possible to get a 3240 x 5760 px png file by right click save.

Please feel free to contact me if you have any inquiries.

Artwork by hasaqui, @hasaqui.
Made with p5js
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Reading a book #402
metadata.description:
The formal structure of a book is beautiful by itself, but its aesthetic is the tacit atmosphere within which events take place in a story.

The WebGL real-time animation sets up an initial grid based on the fxhash. The grid cells get subdivided into another grid and the resulting cells become filled with pixels in color (~33%) or black and white (~66%).
The colored pixels come in 3 different coloring styles.
- Big Palette (~49%)
- Small Palette (~49%)
- Monochrome [b/w] (~2%)
4 noise algorithms modify the pixels of selected grid cells while at the same time 4 reset algorithms reassemble the initial image. The selected cells switch over time.
